title: Comparative law and anthropology
subject: Droit et anthropologie

publisher: Cheltenham, UK : Edward Elgar Publishing Limited
description: "The topical chapters in this cutting-edge collection at the intersection of comparative law and anthropology explore the mutually enriching insights and outlooks of the two fields. Comparative Law and Anthropology adopts a foundational approach to social and cultural issues and their resolution, rather than relying on unified paradigms of research or unified objects of study. Taken together, the contributions extend long-developing trends from legal anthropology to an anthropology of law and from externally imposed to internally generated interpretations of norms and processes of legal significance within particular cultures. The book's expansive conceptualization of comparative law encompasses not only its traditional geographical orientation, but also historical and jurisprudential dimensions. It is also noteworthy in blending the expertise of long-established, acclaimed scholars with new voices from a range of disciplines and backgrounds."
contributor: Nafziger, James A. R., editor.$$QNafziger, James A. R.

Research handbooks in comparative law.$$QResearch handbooks in comparative law.
contents: Part I. Past, present and future -- Law and anthropology : research traditions / Sally Falk Moore -- Whose comparative law? : a global perspective / Laura Nader -- Part II. Complexity, legal pluralism and totality of legal ideas -- Anthropology on trial : the Hindmarsh Island Bridge Controversy (1993-2001) / P.G. McHugh -- First Nation control over archaeological sites : contemporary issues in heritage law, policy and practice / Catherine Bell -- The hybridity of law in Namibia and the role of community law in the Southern African Development Community (SADC) / Oliver C. Ruppel and Katharina Ruppel-Schlichting -- Legal pluralism : linking law and culture in national resource co-management and environmental compliance / Anastasia Telesetsky -- Part III. Substance of legal schemes of meaning and social significance of law -- Anthropology in international law : the case of safeguarding intangible cultural heritage / Janet Blake -- Cultural landscapes significant to indigenous peoples / James A.R. Nafziger -- Governance disputes involving First Nations in Canada : culture, custom and dispute resolution outside of the Indian Act / William B. Shipley -- Part IV. Cosmopolitan comparative perspectives -- Narrative of laws, narratives of peoples / Elina N. Moustaira -- Images of Muhammad : religious law and freedom of expression / Richard Francaviglia -- Part V. Historical orientation -- Law, society and landscape in early Scandinavia / Stefan Brink -- Transgenic maize : the Mexican cultural battle / Jorge Sánchez Cordero -- A trinity of culture, law and politics : legal anthropology of the bonded labor system in Nepal / Upendra D. Acharya -- Part VI. Contextual differences -- Global law firms in real-world contexts : practical limitations and ethical implications / Eve Darian-Smith -- An historical, cultural and political perspective of corruption in the Balkans / Marko Novacović -- Part VII. -- In-depth field research -- The anthropologist as expert witness : a personal account / Richard Price -- Intellectual property law in comparative perspective : the case of trademark 'piracy' in Guatemala / Kedron Thomas -- The voice of the stranger : foreign L.L.M. students' experiences of culture, law and pedagogy in US law schools / Mindie Lazarus-Black -- Part VIII. Relationship with legal anthropological traditions and its theoretical and methodological concerns -- Distance in law and globalisation : armchair anthropology revisited / Riaz Tejani.
